availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: John Anderson being in Jail charged with the offense of murdering J C Moody in Shelby County & being admitted to bail in the sum of One thousand dollars -- Now ^we^ John Anderson principal & William Allison & Zachariah Lee of Franklin County & sureties hereby undertake that the above named John Anderson will appear in the Shelby Quarterly Circuit Court on the first day of its next ^September^ term to answer said charge & will at all times make himself amenable to the order & process of said court in the prosecution of said charge & if convicted will himself in the Execution thereof or if he shall fail to perform either of these conditions that we will pay to the Commonwealth of Kentucky the sum of one thousand dollars

John Anderson
Attest J L Caldwell J S C C } William ^his X mark^ Allison
Zachariah^his X mark^ Lee

24
Commonwealth
v } Bail Bond
John Anderson
